page.title: 02Farming in Uzmaston area.
page.content: This area is mainly rural with 16 farms varying in size from 20 - 140 hectares. Twelve of these are now owner-occupied whereas 30 years ago they were all on estates. Those still rented are {Millin, Cotts Park, Little {Clarboro }and {Deep Lake.}Previously all these would have been dairy farms but now 50% are {livestock and arable} and all employ very little labour. Winter and spring {barley}are grown and {Cedar House}has about 10 hectares of {potatoes.}Grassland provides grazing in summer and pit and big bale silage for winter use. {'Tack sheep'} are brought from areas with a more severe climate (e.g.Builth Wells) to winter at {Hanton Farm,}a fixed sum is paid per sheep for shepherding and the sheep improve the pastures. {Mains {Water}supplies all farms and fields.
